title: From rising rates to petty red tape, the war on shops is killing our High Streets
text:
Searching for retail statistics is a bit like shopping for clothes. It is worth rummaging around for a better colour. Ten days ago, the British Retail Consortium put out a distinctive red collection. The value of retail sales in the 12 months to September, it reported, had plunged by 1.3 per cent – something that BRC chief executive Helen Dickinson blamed on the “spectre of a no deal” Brexit. But if black is more to your taste, the Office of National Statistics (ONS) claimed on Friday that the value of retail sales had risen by 3.4 per cent over the same period. Both sets of figures are supposed to be adjusted for inflation.

What is clear is that viewing the retail industry through the prism...
description: Searching for retail statistics is a bit like shopping for clothes.
